profile_positions.description:
SAFRAN NACELLES 

Secured, measured, analyzed and improved up to 50% year over year the KPIs of the continuous improvement and eradication of non-quality processes, also performing the risk analysis, for the manufacturing lines of the GE Passport20 aircraft nacelles.

Created a program to promote continuous improvement and customer-centric culture by implementing and demonstrating rapid improvement methodologies (QRQC/QRAP, QCD/SQDC).

Piloted the process of management and analysis of SAP transactional records for the eradication of production incidents, through training and accompaniment of operators in the use of causal analysis tools, as well as through the automation of standard quality forms using VB Excel.

Secured and characterized for eradication 22 types of defects exported to customer and more than 70 types of defects imported from internal and external suppliers (including international ones).

Performed periodic internal auditing of manufacturing cells and Routing Cards under the AS/EN9100 standard.

Accompanied the realization of the industrial validation of the sector processes (PPAP vs DVI), sanctioning the validation stages and supporting the industrialization pilot in the determination of key characteristics (KC).

Managed supplier-origin non-conformities and internal derogations through SAP (ERP).

Represented the quality area in the development of the Green Belt Lean six sigma project for the eradication of defects related to the replacement of fasteners.

profile_positions.description:
Consulted, compiled and prioritized the requirements of more than 60 plant managers from more than 20 nationalities to produce the new Global Quality Management Manual as part of the transition from ISO9001:2008 to ISO9001:2015.

Launched and was one of the pilots of the New Quality Policy project, being in charge of the elaboration of the divulgation material for international manufacturing sites.

Led and participated in committees (quality management, project monitoring and development of internal standards) piloting the drafting of new operational standards “Quality Basics″";.

Gathered, compiled and developed a Gap Analysis with plant managers to analyze and identify work priorities and potential sources of resistance to change.

Compiled, developed and delivered online and face-to-face training for over 60 engineers and executives on the intrinsic challenges of the industry and the quality methods to address them (8D,RCA,SPC,5M).

company.name: EPAM Systems
company.description:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.  

Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.

Learn more at  www.epam.com.
